    Cyrille Doux

    PhD student in cosmology. ENS Paris alumnus.

    • Paris, France
    • Site

    Hi there!

    I’m Cyrille Doux, a PhD student in astrophysics and cosmology, currently working at Laboratoire AstroParticule et Cosmologie of Université Paris-Diderot, Paris, France.

    I am working on cross-correlations, that is, the combination of multiple cosmological probes (CMB, galaxies, gravitational lensing, hydrogen clouds, etc.) from various experiments. I am also interested in more fundamental/theoretical matters, such as dark energy and (loop) quantum cosmology.

    I am a member of several science collaborations: SDSS, LSST and Euclid.

    And I’m co-organizer of the French Physicists’ Tournament, an innovative training for undergraduate students by and for research supported by the French Academy of Science and the French Physical Society (in which I am a member of the “Junior” commission).
